Submodules

Phasor.conversions module

This module provides functionalities to convert complex nnumbers to differnt complex notaions

Phasor.conversions.PolarDegreeToPolarRadians(angle)

Convert degree angle to radians

Parameters:

angle (float) – Angle in degree

Return type:

float

Phasor.conversions.PolarDegreeToRectangle(modulus, angle)

Convert polar coordinates to rectangular coordinates when angle is in degrees

Parameters:

  • modulus (float) – Modulus of the complex notation

  • angle (float) – Angle in degrees

Returns:

Rectangular coordinates

Return type:

complex

Phasor.conversions.RectangularToPolarDegree(complex)

Return the corresponding modulus and degree angle for given complex number

complex (complex) – Complex form of the phasor

Returns:

Modulus value and angle value in degrees

Return type:

float,float

complex (complex) – Complex form of the phasor

Returns:

Modulus value and angle value in radians

Phasor.conversions.RoundOff(value, roundOffPoints)

Roundoff the given value to its given decimal points.

Parameters:

  • value (float) – Value to be rounded off.

  • roundOffPoints (int) – Decimal points to be rounded off.

Returns:

Rounded off value

Return type:

float

Phasor.phasor module

Create Phsor objects with different formats and provide capability to do basic phsor calculations

Phasor.phasor.toDeg(phasorObject)

Convert any type of phasor object to PhasorPD object.

Parameters:

phasorObject (Phasor) – Phasor object to be converted.

Raises:

TypeError – If the argument is not a phasor object.

Returns:

Phasor object with polar coordiantes with angles in degrees.

Return type:

PhasorPD

Phasor.phasor.toRad(phasorObject)

Returns:

Phasor.sc module

class Phasor.sc.SCToUnbalanced(A0, A1, A2, roundOff=2)

Bases: object

Generate the corresponding unbalanced three-phase system using symmetrical components.

toDegList()

Convert all Phasor objects to polar coordinates where angle is in degrees.

toRadList()

Convert all Phasor objects to polar coordinates where angle is in radians.

toRecList()

Convert all Phasor objects to rectangular coordinates.
